greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = numerator of n/(n+7).
comment: In general, the numerators of n/(n+p) for prime p and n >= 0 form a sequence with the g.f.: x/(1-x)^2 - (p-1)*x^p/(1-x^p)^2. - _Paul D. Hanna_, Jul 27 2005
Multiplicative with a(p^e) = p^e if p<>7, a(7^e) = 7^(e-1) if e > 0. - _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 18 2011

Generalizing the above comment of Hanna, the numerators of n/(n + k) for a fixed positive integer k and n >= 0 form a sequence with the g.f.: Sum_{d divides k} f(d)*x^d/(1 - x^d)^2, where f(n) is the Dirichlet inverse of the Euler totient function A000010. f(n) is a multiplicative function defined on prime powers p^k by f(p^k) = 1 - p. See A023900. - _Peter Bala_, Feb 17 2019
a(n) <> n iff n = 7 * k, in this case, a(n) = k. - _Bernard Schott_, Feb 19 2019
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
program: (Sage) [lcm(n,7)/7 for n in range(0, 100)] # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Jun 09 2009
(PARI) vector(100, n, n--; numerator(n/(n+7))) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Feb 19 2019
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 15 2005
